document.docAuthor: Barahona-Segovia, Rodrigo M., Riera, Pamela, Pañinao-Monsálvez, Laura, Guzmán, Vicente Valdés & Henríquez-Piskulich, Patricia
document.masterDocTitle: Updating the knowledge of the flower flies (Diptera: Syrphidae) from Chile: Illustrated catalog, extinction risk and biological notes

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Updating the knowledge of the flower flies (Diptera: Syrphidae) from Chile: Illustrated catalog, extinction risk and biological notes

figureCitation.captionText: FIGURES 122–127. (122) Copestylum bradleyi (Curran, 1925) (photo by Matías Barceló), scale bar = 2 mm. (123) Copestylum bulbosum (Fluke, 1951) (photo by Matías Barceló), scale bar = 3 mm. (124) Copestylum cockerelli (Curran, 1927) (photo by Vicente Valdés), scale bar = 3 mm. (125) Copestylum longirostre (Macquart, 1846), lateral view. Scale bar = 2.5 mm (Photo by Vicente Valdés). Copestylum escomeli (Curran, 1929): (126) female and (127) male, feeding on Oxalis sp. (photos by Pedro Vargas).

.

O’Higgins
:

; Los Ríos: Isla Mancera ( Porter 1927a ) (doubtful, probably error in labeling).
Chilean distribution. From Antofagasta to O’Higgins region ( Fig. 145 ).
Altitudinal range. From coastal to highland ecosystems (50– 2,000 m .a.s.l.).

Biology and notes. Thompson (1988) revalidated
C. longirostre
and considered
C. concinna
as a junior synonym of
C. longirostre
. This is one of the most common species of the genus, primarily associated with coastal flowering from the Coastal Desert province ( Morrone 2014 ) and Mediterranean basin of Central Chile . This species has been observed visiting flowers of
Cistanthe
sp. (César Martínez. CSP record);
Echinopsis chiloensis (Colla) Friedrich & G.D. Rowley
(Dickson Jorquera, CSP record);
Eulychnia iquiquensis (K. Schum.) Britton & Rose
(Juan Contreras, CSP record);
Euphorbia lactiflua Phil.
(Benjamín Castro, CSP record);
Fuchsia lycioides Andrews
(César Martínez, CSP record);
H. foliosus
(César Martínez, CSP record);
Nolana
sp. (Rodrigo Castillo, CSP record);
Oxalis
sp. (Pedro Vargas and Chris Olea, CSP records);
Oxalis gigantea Barnéoud
(Francisco Santander, CSP record) and
Proustia cuneifolia D. Don
(Claudio Arancibia, CSP record).
Conservation status. LC; EOO = 136,631 km 2 , AOO = 104 km 2 and 24 localities (or subpopulations).
